data.name: Tommy Vasquez
data.title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer
data.introduction: My beginnings in programming was with powerscript for PowerBuilder development and PL / SQL with Oracle 11g.
bio: For more than 6 years I have dedicated myself more to the operational part of technological infrastructures.
Providing assistance and support with great dedication and responsibility. In this journey, business continuity is always essential for me.
As a personal challenge I set out on the path of web development.
And continue learning in the professional field as a personal.
You can contact me for web development projects and private consultations.

projects.description: Practice your knowledge of basic JavaScript syntax and data structures by building a Random Quote Generator, a program that displays a randomly selected quote each time the user clicks a button.

Displaying a long list of items on a web page, like a list of 200 movie titles or 400 products, can overwhelm a user with too much information at once. A common solution is to display a handful of items on one page and provide navigation to jump to a list of more items. In this project, you'll write JavaScript to divide a long list into a series of pages and improve the user experience of a web page.

Full Stack JavaScript developers create forms to collect information from users for nearly every website and application they build. For this project, you’ll use your skills to enhance a form so that it’s engaging, interactive, and easy to use.

Create a browser-based, word guessing game: Phrase Hunter. You’ll use JavaScript and OOP (Object-Oriented Programming) to select a random, hidden phrase. A player tries to guess the phrase by selecting individual letters from an onscreen keyboard. Can they guess the phrase before they run out of attempts?

Many sites — Twitter, Facebook, IMDB, and Wikipedia to name a few — offer a vast sea of data that you can access and display on your own web pages. Using JavaScript, you’ll create an employee directory by communicating with a third-party API (Application Programming Interface).
